Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can show a plant with enough water by drawing bright green leaves and a healthy appearance.
The student can show a plant without water by drawing wilted or drooping leaves to illustrate an unhealthy appearance.
The student can draw and label sunlight reaching the plant to indicate that plants need light to grow.
The student can represent patterns in the plant's health based on the presence or absence of water.
The student can illustrate a plant both in a watered condition and a dry condition to compare and contrast their appearances.
The student can use colors and labels effectively to differentiate between a healthy, watered plant and a wilted, dry plant.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally forget to label a component such as the sunlight, but this happens inconsistently (minor oversight).
The student might draw sunlight in a less prominent way, not emphasizing its importance as much as water, though still acknowledging its role (misjudged emphasis).
